subject: Re: [junit] How to assert a given string is UTF-8 encoded?
msgSnippet: Not sure what you mean. All strings/characters in Java are unicode and the encoding should be opaque to you. UTF-8 is an encoding for writing
messageBody:
Not sure what you mean. All strings/characters in Java are unicode and
the encoding should be opaque to you.

UTF-8 is an encoding for writing strings/characters out to a stream. All
unicode characters can be written to UTF-8.

I am sure there is a real requirement here, but I think we need a little
more information to understand what it is and to help you test for it.

Kevin

Ritesh wrote:
>
>
> Hi Guys,
>
> I have a requirement where I need to be able to assert that any given
> String object (in Java ofcourse) is UTF8 or not. Meaning all the
> characters in the string are actually UTF-8 characters.
>
> I have some ideas, but I want to see if someone has a better idea or
> the solution is already out there.
>
> Does anyone know how to do that?
>
> Thanks in advance
